metadata.name: Edward Thompson

persona.name: Priya Desai
persona.role: IT Coordinator, multi-site dental practice (4 locations)
persona.goal: Explore Ethernet/dedicated connectivity options and confirm serviceability per address
persona.context: Responsible for network reliability across locations; wants redundancy; needs to verify addresses and get an appointment with a business specialist

intent.name: General Greeting / Start Conversation
intent.description: A customer opens with a greeting or minimal context, requiring a clarifying question to route.
intent.goal: Determine whether they are a new sales lead or an existing customer needing support.

emotion.name: Anxious
emotion.description: Worried about downtime or deadlines; asks repeated reassurance questions about install dates, service continuity, or disruptions.

metadata.outcome: Appointment scheduled with business specialist and expectations for the call confirmed.

turns.content: Sure thing—happy to help. What can I assist you with today?

messages: Sure thing—happy to help. What can I assist you with today?

turns.content: I’m trying to sort out dedicated internet options for our dental offices and confirm what’s actually serviceable at each address, plus realistic install timelines—I really can’t afford downtime. Can you help me with that, and do you work with business Ethernet/dedicated circuits or just standard broadband?
I can help with dedicated internet and checking service at each office. May I have your name and confirm this is for your dental business?

messages: I can help with dedicated internet and checking service at each office. May I have your name and confirm this is for your dental business?

turns.content:
Yes, thanks. My name is Priya Desai, and this is for our multi-site dental practice, BrightSmile Dental Group.  

What else do you need from me to check Ethernet/dedicated availability—addresses, ZIPs, anything specific? I’m really trying to understand what’s realistic on install dates so I can plan around patient schedules and avoid any downtime.
Great, Priya. Can you share a preferred date, time, and timezone for a quick call with our Business Class agent?

messages: Great, Priya. Can you share a preferred date, time, and timezone for a quick call with our Business Class agent?

turns.content:
Sure. Ideally, I’d like something this Thursday at 10:00 am Eastern, or if that’s not available, anytime between 9–11 am Eastern on Friday.  

On that call, can they walk me through Ethernet vs. other dedicated options and give realistic install windows per address? I’m really nervous about any disruption to existing service during the cutover.
Great, Priya. You’re all set for January 15, 2026, 10:00 AM ET. You’ll get a text with the phone number to call about 5 minutes before your appointment. Anything else I can help with today?

messages: Great, Priya. You’re all set for January 15, 2026, 10:00 AM ET. You’ll get a text with the phone number to call about 5 minutes before your appointment. Anything else I can help with today?

turns.content:
That works, thank you. Just to confirm: on that call they’ll be able to look up serviceability per address, discuss Ethernet vs. other dedicated options, and give me realistic install/cutover timelines so I can avoid downtime, right?  

If so, that’s all I needed for now.
